topic.title: What is ZeroNets opinion on this app applauded by law enforcement?
topic.body:
https://www.lightcatch.net/
https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/lightcatch-grande-prairie-darren-boyer-alberta-crime-1.5194139

This app allows users to take pictures, make post about crimes, and uses geo locations.
Needless to say the police love this.  I do not advocate for crime, but I have my concerns with the average citizens playing super hero crime fighter abusing this, etc.  The app is called "LightCatch"  
What are your thoughts on this use of technology?

topic.body:

topic.body: What rules or regulations are you subject to that have no purpose other than to make you submit to the authorities or ruling class?

topic.title: Gratitude
topic.body:
Name something you are grateful for right now?
For me, I am happy to have a day off work,  having a coffee and staying warm.
I am not dodging bullets, so for that, I am grateful.

topic.title: Anyone using Kai os?  Thoughts?
topic.body: Pretty limited, but no need to sign into any accounts to use it.  Got a web browser with duck duck go (no apps).  So far I like it :).   I don't feel my privacy is totally being violated more than one would expect.

topic.title: What is God?
topic.body: Legit question.  I have no idea and cannot seem to find answers.   Any opinions?

topic.title: Why are you single?
topic.body: Not the usual topic but why not.  Good question for self reflection and maybe some laughs.

topic.title: How would you spend your time if forced into self isolation?
topic.body:
Seems to be a real possibility lately.   I would probably try to learn more about computers and coding.
Maybe even smoke some marijuana, lol.

topic.title: How is everyone?
topic.body:
Are we all cozy?  Is shit hitting the fan where you are at?  How are things in your bubble?
For me this seems to be more of a media frenzy than actual chaos atm so I thought I would ask.

1565148429_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [nickwa](#comment_214_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehEEKKJj): ZeroNet is not blockchain. Its peer to peer where everyone shares their resources, and it gets copied to multiple different computers. By copying the content, the data becomes un-censorable due to it being in multiple places. This allows for mirrors to exist inside and outside of ZeroNet. Also, you can delete content that you downloaded from ZeroNet. Also, I just heard the 8chan on ZeroNet got CP posts, since the chans usually get those type of people. I heard the advice to avoid the site because technically having the CP and seeding(you sharing your resource of content you downloaded) it is illegal. This is why I mostly don't just wander on random sites on ZeroNet, and like to stay on text stuff, and click to download like ZeroMe. 8chan on ZeroNet runs on where it just downloads straight. On ZeroMe, there is less risk, since you wont accidentally download something illegal just by browsing. If you want a example of what I mean, you can go here for ZeroMe: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/ It will have content of "show image" to get the image, instead of just downloading images all the time.

Thx,  That is helpful,   I will check out zero me, keep the system clean and be cautious.     I think decentralized internet is a great idea...  I know it takes power away from some and want to be safe.  We should have these freedoms but things are upside down.   extremists everywhere lol

> [nickwa](#comment_215_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehEEKKJj): If you want to have a blocklist that blocks harmful sites: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Styromaniac.blocklist.bit/ Just click the thing to enable it, then there should be a prompt on the upper right to "add content", just click add. If you dont want to enable some of the blocklists, you dont have to. If you also have any questions on blocking things yourself, just ask.

Awesome,   thx, just checking it out now.   it looks very useful,   i blocked the sites already,   I figured that youtube site was trash:)  and millchan.

right on, thanks for those block lists,  i flicked them all on and appreciate that.   i checked out zeronet a few months ago and then checked out freenet.   been distro hopping too.  ive settled on a distro and think ill stick to zeronet. you been here awhile?

> [zeronetanon4](#comment_6_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6LcK7v): This is sortof a variant of that question of which came first... the chicken or the egg.  You need people to drive interest, and you need interest to drive people.  08Chan helps.  The lowest hanging fruit to get more people IMO would be to reform groups of people kicked off of traditional social media sites.  Websites with unique and valuable information are good as well.  Some people just have to take the leap in the beginning, and create content even if there is no one initially there to see it.

zeronet been getting "some" press,    ill do my best to spread the word but its hard to compete with corporate influence. > [zeronetanon4](#comment_7_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6LcK7v): I think the truth to that is this technology isn't meant for everyone.  There is a small demographic of people who this is targeted at.  Most if not all of us can see the trajectory of free speech on the normal internet, and as a result our infrastructure for communication must become more sophisticated.  As cool as the concept is right now, its still in its infancy.  A lot more functionality and systems will be added to it as time goes on.  We are the early adopters who see the potential in this.  What we want this to become is intrinsically part of its growth process as it matures as a project.  More people understanding and appreciating what ZeroNet is will come as it grows.

I personally feel its a second chance for the internet.  I am very excited with zeronet and decentralization.   I just have a strong negativity bias when it come to the powers that be and the ways they try to keep things down until they can gain control of it.  I feel bad to think of all the people in the past who create something amazing just to get screwed by some big corporation.

> [zeronetanon4](#comment_10_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6LcK7v): The one thing the smaller entity always has an advantage over is speed.  There is little to no red tape or bureaucracy to slow you down, and there is no giant apparatus you need to redirect.  There are a lot of VERY intelligent people attracted to projects such as these.  When you get groups of people such as that to passionately focus on a central goal, the output can rival that of major corporations.  Things are heating up more and more where you'll see such collaborations occur more frequently. [...]

I agree,  the power they have certainly is not truth.  They are afraid as they should be, and things are heating up fast lol. > [nickwa](#comment_404_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehEEKKJj): Your IP is visible to your VPN since your VPN is the first thing you connect to. Your ISP would not know what you are doing if your using a VPN since it is being encrypted. Using VPN > Tor means that VPN will only see Tor on exit. Doing Tor > VPN after that means you will not be exposed if you are a exit node. Also, your ISP only sees your connecting to Tor if you just connect straight to Tor, not the info inside of Tor due to the nature of nodes(same with the VPN). Your ISP always knows your IP anyways, but the point is to encrypt the traffic so your ISP will not know what you are doing. The only main weakness of doing VPN > Tor > VPN is if the VPN provider gets compromised by government since all your info is centralized on the VPN.

> [nickwa](#comment_405_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehEEKKJj): Majority of the time is fine, but like I said, somebody can expose your information. Its if your someone spies on the exit node. "No protection from malicious Tor exit nodes. Non-HTTPS traffic entering and leaving Tor exit nodes is unencrypted and could be monitored. Unless some additional form of encryption is used (such as HTTPS), this means that anyone running the exit node can spy on users’ internet traffic." [...]

> [nickwa](#comment_408_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehEEKKJj): Its PC > ISP(Only sees Tor) > Tor Network > 2nd ISP(Only see's Tor if 2nd PC is using it too) > PC. With VPN its PC > ISP > VPN(Now ISP does not see Tor, but sees VPN) > Tor(VPN now sees Tor, but Tor sees only VPN IP address). The only problem like I said is through the Tor network if its not encrypted, can be caught. Using VPN before Tor benefit is encryption so your ISP does not see. This does not encrypt once it exits the VPN though. That is where things like HTTPS comes into play. ZeroNet only goes through Tor for people who have it on. Even if you do not have Tor on, other people using it is still seeding with you.

> [theecollector](#comment_61_15rMfe5FVSWwMffJvTpBUq9dFiLQPNxkuU): thank you. This is probably the most useful information in all of Zeronet. The toxic level is off the CHARTS!!

You are welcome. Glad you find this useful and hope it can be helpful for you.  One thing you might find interesting is CBT(Cognitive Behavioral Therapy) You could research it online.  I have found it to be most useful for myself.  It's a simple concept that takes practice.  In essence,  Its about our own thoughts and how quickly we react to beliefs that may or may not be accurate.  Its about slowing down the process and basically questioning everything. And being aware of our many automatic thoughts that happen very quickly and go unnoticed.  If we can have better control of our automaitic thoughts.. we then should have better control of our automatic reactive behavior.   And in theory.. life, interactions, and stress levels should automatically get better.  I think they should teach it in school, but it would go against the status quo.  It's worth checking out if you have not already.

> [styromaniac@kxoid.bit](#comment_146_1PxcegJ1mKoMHeS73f9MvXeUWDq8BdnSv3): So that's what it's about. I may have needed that. Then again, I'm pretty calm lately.

And catch ourselves beating ourselves up with negative self talk, which is natural but not good for overall happiness.  This therapy trains us to make well thought out decisions over automatic reactions. I think anyone with and open mind and willing to be honest with themselves would benefit huge.  I should upload material sometime. (need a scanner)  Its psychoactive therapy rather than the typical psychiatry that is most common.  Its the reason I do not take meds or self medicate.  Its helped my stress threshold incredibly.  Like everything though.. moderation and to be taken it with a grain of salt.  It's all about the balance.  Its a can of worms to open as well.  When i got better at taking myself off "autopilot" and taking more control..  i really noticed how the people around me fly on autopilot and are quick to believe and react in this fast paced world.  Will start to realize the world is far more insane than you might have believed yourself to be.  This therapy goes straight at your own core beliefs and how they are mostly inaccurate.  Everything thought, belief, or action must have evidence.

1573396729_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: That is just our old primal friend "the negativity bias"   We are predisposed to worry about things that could possibly go wrong, this keeps us safe (it's a good thing).  Being aware of this "bias" is good knowledge.  We also tend to gloss over things that are going well too.  IMO it is important to make the effort to be grateful for how good things really are,  because they could be 10 x worst than our worst nightmares.  So everyday that passes that has not been horrible was a good day and one must be grateful.  This also helps train the thought patterns.  We are all prisoners of our own minds until we can become the master.

It's easy to live in the past and worry about the future,  I have spent most of my life doing this,  Being present in the moment and focusing on what is happening right now seems to be far less stressful.  Gotta let the past go and adapt to what is needed right now.  The future is gonna be stressful for everyone to think about.  What you are doing right now dictates much of the future.

Mind pollution is also good to consider.  If we intake freaky information all the time, This does influence us,  One must know when to walk away from negativity or any information that causes a lot of concern.  We can only process so much at a time.  LOL like ZeroNet,  I have not been on for a while and come back to mostly posts about suicide and linux.  Humans are hive minded and Zeronet is no exception.
